text:
Many components are failing whenever the server wants to be started. The error
that is given each time is that there is an endline comment where a command
should be. When I put in the comment the server fails out everytime.
creator: pikkon@dansgameday.gotdns.com

text:
Can you please be more specific and post some of the exact error messages you're seeing, and 
also the corresponding lines from your config file?
creator: jwoolley@apache.org

text:
Here is the error that I am receiving:
Starting httpd: [Thu Feb 27 20:42:53 2003] [warn] Apache does not support
line-end comments. Consider using quotes around argument: "#-1"
Syntax error on line 367 of /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf:
Invalid command 'UserDir', perhaps mis-spelled or defined by a module not
included in the server configuration
[FAILED]

and here are some lines of my config file.

creator: pikkon@dansgameday.gotdns.com

text:
errr, line-end comment? That's an 1.3 error message. It isn't emitted by 2.0.
There's no such text in the current source tree.

The other thing: You have to enable mod_userdir in order to use the Userdir
directive...

Are you sure, you're starting the correct httpd?
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Well, it sounds like there are two different things going on.  The UserDir thing is probably just 
because you don't have mod_userdir loaded.  The end-line-comments thing might be because 
your config file has DOS line endings, if I had to guess. 
 
Please refer this problem to the user support list, as I don't think it's an actual bug... 
http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html 
 
Thanks for using Apache. 
--Cliff
creator: jwoolley@apache.org
